author: JamesWTruher
body: we still have a number of cmdlets without any tests, those test gaps should be closed

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body:
@JamesWTruher It would be good to gather a task list of Cmdlets missing tests in this issue and then in this thread people (like me for example) could put forward a claim to write those tests so that there is a confirmed plan ahead.

Do you think that sounds like a good idea?

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
Here's a pointer to a doc that outlines all the cmdlets that have _some_ kind of coverage (even if it's extremely minimal): https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/testing-guidelines/PowerShellCoreTestStatus.md

@JamesWTruher: do you think it's worth it to enumerate some high-pri gaps in that doc?

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: @JamesWTruher: this might be a generic enough issue that we can close it. If you agree, go for it.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Closing this as it's not actionable.  Once we start having reliable code coverage data, we should open separate issues for additional test coverage.

title: there are still test gaps in our cmdlet coverage
